result.execSummary:
The defendant Bernard Barnett was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Bernard Barnett

records.addlTxt: No reply from the defendant or surety. vp

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing hearing proceeded. Statements made by the State, Defense counsel and defendant						

The court sentenced the defendant to 3 Months in the House of Correction,with credit for 44 days time served.  Court IMPOSED AND STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 12 Months.
If revoked 44 days credit for time served to be applied and Huber privileges under Sec.303.08 Wis. Stats. to apply. 

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION 
Maintain full time employment and/or schooling.
20 Hours of Community service
Letter of apology to Planet Fitness
No contact with any Planet Fitness
Provide a DNA sample. DNA surcharge Imposed.
Pay a fine of  $133.58 plus all  costs, fees and surcharges(including DNA) within 6 Months. Failure to pay will result in civil judgment/tax intercept.  
Cash on deposit to be applied, if applicable.
Appellate rights notice given to the defendant.

Documents received and filed.
Notice of right to seek post conviction relief
Pretrial Incarceration form

Defendant Bernard Barnett in court with attorney Joel Alan Mogren.  Defendant Bernard Barnett in custody.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: sm  
Case in court for plea and sentencing hearing. Parties have reached a resolution. State placed negotiations on the record. Defense counsel and defendant confirms. 
State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law.

Plea hearing held

AS TO COUNT 1
Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his/her Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if he is not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.   Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum and Jury Instruction, received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.   Court ordered a DNA sample and advised defendant of applicable surcharge.

Attorney Joel Alan Mogren in court, defendant Bernard Barnett not in court, in custody.  May Y. Lee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: sm  
Case in court for statusl conference. Defense requests a plea hearing date. Case remains calendared in Branch 31.  Plea hearing scheduled for June 6, 2017 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Bernard Barnett in court with attorney Joel Alan Mogren.  Defendant Bernard Barnett in custody.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: sm
Case in court for bailbond hearing. Attorney Mogren newly appointed to this case. State turned over discovery. Defense confirms. Statement made as to modification of bail. Court orders set bail previosly order remains in place. Defense request a status conference date.
  Status conference scheduled for May 16, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant advised No Contact Order remains in full force and effect.  Defendant to have no contact with Planet Fitness.  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Court ordered Defendant held in the Milwaukee County Jail until turned over to Justice Point.  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Hannah Dugan, Branch 31.

Defendant Bernard Barnett in court with attorney J. Dennis Thornton.  Defendant Bernard Barnett in custody.  May Y. Lee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for May 3, 2017 at 08:30 am.
Defendant's Bail Forfeiture Notice returned undeliverable.
Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant; Original in file. ($250.00 signature bond) gj
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 250.00.
Cash bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 200.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Attorney Francisco Araiza in court earlier.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Defendant failing to appear on September 24, 2015, Court ordered a bench warrant to be issued.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with PLANET FITNESS.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

NO ACTION TAKEN ON $200 CASH BAIL PREVIOUSLY POSTED.
Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Bernard Barnett in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  Defendant Bernard Barnett in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 25, 2015 at 08:30 am.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Bernard Barnett not in court.  Joanne L Hardtke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.  Court makes finding that there is a possible victim identified, therefore, Court stays order of forfeiture with recompense to be determined at close of case.vb
